column4: hello, does anybody know whether ubuntu supports the WAP protocol for wireless security?
you mean WPA
yeah rausb0
I've got other problem with it as well... it also won't work with a static IP (only on DHCP)
is has support for WPA (using wpa_supplicant), but only for those wlan drivers which are usable by wpa_supplicant
how can I check it, rausb0?
which wlan driver do you use?
I have no idea, to be honest, rausb0
then i cannot tell you
can I check it somehow? rausb0?
the output of lsmod would be helpful. but not here, use pastebin for that.
ok hold on, rausb0
http://pastebin.com/d24a3ce54
rausb0

okay, you have two concurrent drivers loaded for your card: orinoco_cs and hostap_cs. it should be only hostap_cs. and for using wpa with those old cards, the card firmware must be update. not an easy task.
can I just unload that other driver first? that may solve some problems :), rausb0
it would be better to blacklist the orinoco_cs driver, so it doesn't get loaded in the first place
that is fine with me, but I am not sure where to find that blacklist file
i think it is /etc/modprobe.conf  (not sure though)
what about just orinoco? should this one stay untouched? rausb0
orinoco is just a support module for orinoco_cs. you don't need to blacklist that one.
sorry, gotta go
